sections.heading: Short title.
sections.text: This Act may be cited as the Children's Product Safety Act.

sections.heading: Exception. The commercial dealer, manufacturer, importer, distributor, wholesaler, or retailer shall not be found in violation of Section 15
sections.text:
if the specific recalled product sold was not included on the Department of
Public Health's list on the day before the sale.

sections.heading: Penalty. Except as provided in Section 20, a
sections.text: commercial dealer, importer, distributor, wholesaler, or retailer who violates this Act by failing to exercise reasonable care is subject to a civil penalty in an amount not to exceed $500 for each day that the violation continues.

sections.heading: Issuance of recalls by other entities prohibited
sections.text: Nothing in this Act shall be interpreted to allow a unit of State or local government or any other entity within the State to issue recalls.

sections.heading: Federal requirements. Nothing in this Act relieves a commercial dealer, manufacturer, importer, distributor, wholesaler, or retailer from compliance with stricter requirements that may be imposed by an agency of the federal government
sections.text: Federal requirements. Nothing in this Act relieves a commercial dealer, manufacturer, importer, distributor, wholesaler, or retailer from compliance with stricter requirements that may be imposed by an agency of the federal government.

sections.heading: Remedies.
sections.text:
Remedies available under this Act are in addition to
any other remedies or procedures under any other provision of law that may be
available to an aggrieved party.
